title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in Long Island City

content.rendered:
Long Island City is always abuzz with excitement. If you are looking to find rooms for rent in Long Island City, you will love this residential and commercial area, because it is all shades of fun.

We’re here to tell you everything you need to know when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Long Island City. From the average rent in Long Island City to public transit in Long Island City, safety, restaurants, and more, we’ve got you covered.

So, let’s begin.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in East Bronx

Where is Long Island City?

When you add the Nassau counties and the Suffolk community together, you get Long Island City. Long Island City is a lengthy expanse of land along the western end of Queens. At its widest, it is just 23 miles across. It is bordered to the North by Astoria, to the South by Newtown Creek, to the East by Hazen Street and New Calvary Cemetery, and to the west by East River.

Find Rooms For Rent in Long Island City

Find Rooms For Rent In Long Island City, Queens

You will be spoilt for choice when searching for rooms for rent in Long Island City. This is because there are a variety of rooms and homes available to rent. You name it, it’s there! From old-style walk-ups to single-unit family homes, townhouses, a mobile or recreational house, or even a brownstone or luxury condo, you can find whatever you’re looking for in Long Island City.

However, what you choose will be determined by your budget. Check out the average rent in Long Island City below.

Average rent in Long Island City

As with most neighborhoods, the average rent in Long Island City depends on the number of rooms in the apartment.

Is Long Island City safe?

It is only natural that you will be concerned about your safety when you are on the lookout for rooms for rent in Long Island City. Long Island City is relatively safe. Nonetheless, here are a few tools to help you stay abreast of what is happening in the area, so you can keep yourself even safer in Long Island City.

  1. AreaVibes: Using AreaVibes, you can check out the livability score of any area where you might find rooms for rent in Long Island City. The livability score is generated using the area’s zip code. The app generates an aggregate score after weighing the amenities, cost of living, safety rates, education, employment, housing, and weather in the area.
  2. Trulia: This site shows you the average rent and restaurants in Long Island City. It also sports reviews from residents and information on safety and grocery shopping in Long Island City. It’s a necessary reference app when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Long Island City.
  3. AroundMe: Instead of getting lost and exposing yourself unduly to dangers, this tool helps you search for relevant establishments in the area. It allows you to search for the nearest bank, gas station, hotel, or restaurant to you.
  4. Hotline Numbers: In case of any emergency, call the toll-free line, 911. There is an additional citizens hotline for non-emergencies. You can dial 311 at any time to report cases of abandoned vehicles, noise complaints, graffiti, or to make a service inquiry.

Public Transit in Long Island City

Being familiar with public transit options in the neighborhood can help you get around quickly while looking for rooms for rent in Long Island City.

1. Walkability

Aside from the great deals on rooms for rent in Long Island City, this neighborhood is among the most walkable in New York City. With a Walk Score of 95, it is the 52nd most walkable neighborhood in the metropolis. You can easily go about your daily tasks without a car.

2. Roads & Traffic

Being a commercial and residential area, the roads tend to be congested during the day. Thankfully, this lightens off in the evenings, making it easier for you to get where you’re going.

3. Nearby Train Stations

Knowing where to look for a train can help you get across town more quickly. Check out the closest train stations to Long Island City.

4. Bus Stops

Long Island City is serviced by 7 buses spread across the Suffolk and Nassau communities. They are Greyhound, Huntington Area Rapid Transit (Hart Bus), MTA Long Island Bus, MTA Long Island Bus Metro, Nassau Inter-County Express (NICE), Suffolk County Transit, Village of Patchogue Owned Bus. These bus lines will serve you well when you’re searching for rooms for rent in Long Island City.

Restaurants in Long Island City

1. Beebe’s

Beebe’s serves New York classics like patties and pizza. While eating in the dining room, you can also enjoy an amazing view of the city’s skyline. In the fall, courtyard sitting is also allowed.

Website

2. LIC Market

Everyone in the neighborhood needs a go-to brunch spot. This is the gap being addressed by LIC Market. For dinner, ingredients are locally sourced, and natural wines are brought into the mix.

Website

3. Petey’s Burger

If you like homemade burgers, Petey’s Burger is the place to go. By using hormone-free black angus beef, the classic burger has been upgraded. Veggie options are also included on the menu! Most importantly, the burgers are available for less than $5.

Order takeout

Parks in Long Island City

1. Gantry Plaza State Park

If you fancy an apartment near a well-groomed garden, a mist fountain, a gantry, and 12 acres of riverside oasis, Gantry Plaza State Park is reason enough to find a room for rent in Long Island City.

Get directions

2. Hunter’s Point South Park

You’d never guess that this green, waterfront park was once an abandoned industrial complex. These days, it even features a 30-foot cantilevered platform that offers a spectacular view of the skyline.

Visit website

3. Socrates Sculpture Park

Located at the meeting point of the East River and Harlem is Socrates Sculpture Park, an outdoor museum and public park where artists and creators can create and exhibit sculptures and multi-media art installations. You will love it here.

Get Directions

Shopping in Long Island City

The Brass Owl

It’s not just rooms you’ll find for rent in Long Island City. Here, you’ll also find the Brass Owl. Whether it is designer clothing and shoes or accessories gifts you’re after, The Brass Owl has got you covered.

Visit website

Just Things

Just Things may be just a thrift and consignment store but it’s a brilliant place to go when you’re shopping on a budget in Long Island City.

Get direction

Koufuku Mart

Koufuku is a Japanese grocery store. However, you will also find all kinds of products, foods, and goodies from all over Asia there. If you favor Asian brands, getting a room for rent in Long Island City will keep you close to this grocery store.

Get Direction

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Long Island
